perturbation.original_text:
YOUR RIGHT TO RETURN AND REFUND EXPIRES 30 DAYS AFTER PURCHASE FROM CISCO OR
AN AUTHORIZED CISCO RESELLER, AND APPLIES ONLY IF CUSTOMER IS THE ORIGINAL END USER PURCHASER.
perturbation.changed_text:
YOUR RIGHT TO RETURN AND REFUND EXPIRES 14 DAYS AFTER PURCHASE FROM CISCO OR
AN AUTHORIZED CISCO RESELLER, AND APPLIES ONLY IF CUSTOMER IS THE ORIGINAL END USER PURCHASER.
perturbation.explanation: This modification shortens the return and refund period to 14 days. This could be a contradiction to consumer protection laws in certain states (including California) that mandate a longer return window in specific circumstances, thus creating non-compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Consumer Rights Laws (e.g., specific industry return policies)

perturbation.original_text:
Cisco warrants that commencing from the date of shipment to Customer (but in case of resale by an authorized Cisco reseller, commencing not more
than ninety (90) days after original shipment by Cisco), and continuing for a period of the longer of (a) ninety (90) days or (b) the software
warranty period (if any) set forth in the warranty card accompanying the Product (if any): (a) the media on which the Software is furnished will be
free of defects in materials and workmanship under normal use; and (b) the Software substantially conforms to its published specifications.
perturbation.changed_text:
Cisco warrants that commencing from the date of shipment to Customer (but in case of resale by an authorized Cisco reseller, commencing not more
than thirty (30) days after original shipment by Cisco), and continuing for a period of the longer of (a) thirty (30) days or (b) the software
warranty period (if any) set forth in the warranty card accompanying the Product (if any): (a) the media on which the Software is furnished will be
free of defects in materials and workmanship under normal use; and (b) the Software substantially conforms to its published specifications.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the warranty period to 30 days may conflict with implied warranty laws like the implied warranty of merchantability that could extend longer than 30 days depending on the jurisdiction and product. This creates a potential legal contradiction by limiting the consumer's rights below what is legally protected.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Warranty Laws (e.g., Uniform Commercial Code in the US)

perturbation.original_text:
The Warranty and the Software License shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of California, without
reference to principles of conflict of laws. The United Nations Convention on the International Sale of Goods shall not apply.
perturbation.changed_text:
The Warranty and the Software License shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware, without
reference to principles of conflict of laws. The United Nations Convention on the International Sale of Goods shall apply.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the governing law to Delaware is not itself a direct contradiction. However, stating that 'The United Nations Convention on the International Sale of Goods shall apply' might become one, because the contract does not specify where the parties are in different countries or not. It could create a conflict if the contract should be governed under United Nations Convention on the International Sale of Goods based on location of the parties.
perturbation.contradicted_law: United Nations Convention on the International Sale of Goods
